item.name: 1. Current weather data
1.1. Positive tests for check current city data
item.description: This folder contains positive tests for functionality "Current weather data". Link to documentation - https://openweathermap.org/current. Cities are chosen from different continents of the Earth. Because tests need to cover the most different coordinates of the planet.

item.name: 1.3. Multilingual tests for check current city data

item.name: 2. 5 day / 3 hour forecast
item.description: This folder contains all tests for functionality "5 day / 3 hour forecast". Link to documentation - https://openweathermap.org/forecast5

item.name: 1. Check current weather data in request by city name (Kiev)

exec: tests[responseFromServer[i] + " is present in response from server"] = result;
tests["Response forecast has records for 5days / 3h"] = response.list.filter(v=>"dt" in v).length == 40;

item.name: 3. Weather map layers
item.description: This folder contains positive tests for functionality "Weather map layerst". Link to documentation - https://openweathermap.org/api/weathermaps

item.name: 1.  Clouds map layer request in maps.owm.io (name = clouds_new)
2. Clouds map layer request (name = clouds_new)
3. Precipitation map layers request (name = precipitation_new)
4. Sea level pressure map layers request (name = pressure_new)
5. Wind speed map layers request (name = wind_new)
6. Temperature map layers request (name = temp_new)
7. Request by invalid layer's name = layer_new
8. Request by empty (default) layer's name
4. UV Index
item.description: This folder contains all tests for functionality "UV Index". Link to documentation - https://openweathermap.org/api/uvi

item.name: 1.1. Check current UV data by geographic coordinates (lat=50.43, lon=30.53)

exec: pm.test("Response from server has a body", function () {

pm.test("Expected value of latitude coordinate is present", function () {
pm.test("Expected keys 'date_iso', 'date' and 'value' are presen in response", function () {

item.name: 4.1. Check historical UV data by geographic coordinates with date (start date=1 January 2018, end date=8 January 2018)
